tool.name: Scatter Plot 2D (Beta)
tool.command:
scatter.py --input $input --ID $uniqID
--X $x --Y $y --figure $figure
#if $pca --pca #end if
#if $design --design $design #end if
#if $group --group $group #end if
#if $paletteGroup --pallete_group $paletteGroup #end if
#if $palette --pallete $palette #end if

param.name: input
param.label: Wide Dataset
param.help: Input dataset in wide format and tab separated. If file is not tab separated see TIP below.

param.name: uniqID
param.label: Unique Feature ID
param.help: Name of the column in your Wide Dataset that has unique Feature IDs.

param.name: x
param.label: X Group Title
param.help: Name of the column for X values.

param.name: y
param.label: Y Group Title
param.help: Name of the column for Y values.

param.name: pca
param.label: Use PCA Data?
param.help: Using a PCA output or standard dataset

param.name: design
param.label: Design File [Optional]
param.help: Design file tab separated. Note you need a 'sampleID' column. If not tab separated see TIP below

param.name: group
param.label: Input Group name to separate by [Optional]
param.help: Enter group name to calculate from. Spelling and capitalization must be exact

tool.help:
@TIP_AND_WARNING@
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool creates a 2D Scatter Plot of your data
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Input**
- Two input datasets are required.
@WIDE@
**NOTE:** The sample IDs must match the sample IDs in the Design File (below). Extra columns will automatically be ignored.
@METADATA@
**In addition to your datasets, you need to provide:**
**Unique Feature ID**
- The column name in your wide dataset that contains the unique IDs for your features. In our example dataset you would input *Feature*.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Output Files**
- This tool outputs a PDF of your Scatter Plot
